echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status &> /dev/null; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Starting interactive authentication..."
        echo "This will open the browser for you to approve the device."
        echo ""
        
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale --socket=\"$TS_SOCKET\" up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Run tailscale up and capture output with better error handling
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📝 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Full output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Extract URL from output - try multiple patterns
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        # Alternative pattern in case the format is different
        if [ -z "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com[^[:space:]]*' | head -1)
        fi
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🌐 Found authentication URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo "🖱️  Attempting to open in browser..."
            
            # Try multiple methods to open URL
            OPENED=false
            
            if command -v python3 >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo "  Trying python3 webbrowser..."
                if python3 -c "import webbrowser; webbrowser.open('$AUTH_URL')" 2>&1; then
                    OPENED=true
                    echo "  ✅ Opened with python3"
                fi
            fi
            
            if ! $OPENED && command -v xdg-open >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo "  Trying xdg-open..."
                if xdg-open "$AUTH_URL" 2>&1; then
                    OPENED=true
                    echo "  ✅ Opened with xdg-open"
                fi
            fi
            
            if ! $OPENED; then
                echo "  ⚠️  Could not auto-open browser. Please manually open:"
            fi
            
            echo ""
            echo "🔗 Authentication URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open the URL above in your browser, approve the device, then press ENTER to continue..."
            read -r

fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# Setup Tailscale userspace configuration (no sudo required)
# Runs as vscode user during container creation

set -e

echo "Setting up Tailscale userspace configuration..."

# Create state directory (Docker volume, can't chmod)
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Create start script
cat > ~/start-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Start Tailscale in userspace mode (no sudo needed)

set -e

# Check if already running
if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon already running"
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock status
    exit 0
fi

echo "Starting Tailscale in userspace mode..."

# Create socket directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Debug: check permissions
echo "Directory permissions: $(ls -ld ~/.tailscale)"
echo "Can write test: $(touch ~/.tailscale/test.txt 2>&1 && echo "OK" || echo "FAILED")"
rm -f ~/.tailscale/test.txt

# Start daemon in background with userspace networking
echo "Starting tailscaled daemon..."
tailscaled \
    --tun=userspace-networking \
    --socks5-server=localhost:1055 \
    --state=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.state \
    --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock \
    > /home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.log 2>&1 &

# Wait for daemon to start
echo "Waiting for Tailscale daemon to start..."
for i in {1..10}; do
    if [ -S ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock ]; then
        echo "Tailscale daemon started successfully"
        break
    fi
    if [ $i -eq 10 ]; then
        echo "Error: Tailscale daemon failed to start"
        echo "Debug info:"
        ls -la ~/.tailscale/
        if [ -f ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log ]; then
            echo "Log contents:"
            tail -20 ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log
        else
            echo "No log file found"
        fi
        exit 1
    fi
    sleep 1
done

# Configure Tailscale with SSH
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
    echo "Configuring Tailscale with provided auth key..."
    tailscale up \
        --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" \
        --ssh \
        --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
    echo "✅ Tailscale configured successfully!"
else
    echo "⚠️ No auth key provided - authentication will be required."
    echo "Run ./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh after container setup to authenticate."
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/start-tailscale.sh

# Create status/info script
cat > ~/tailscale-info.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Get Tailscale connection info (no sudo needed)

export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
    echo "Start with: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
    exit 1
fi

if ! [ -S "$TS_SOCKET" ]; then
    echo "Tailscale socket not found at $TS_SOCKET"
    exit 1
fi

echo "========================================="
echo "Tailscale Status"
echo "========================================="
tailscale status
echo ""
echo "Tailscale IP addresses:"
tailscale ip
echo ""

# Get the main IPv4 address
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "Mobile SSH Connection Commands:"
    echo "  Direct IP:  ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "  Hostname:   ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "For stable mobile connections (MOSH):"
    echo "  mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "Container Details:"
    echo "  Android Serial: ${ANDROID_SERIAL:-<not set>}"
    echo "  SSH via Tailscale: Available"
else
    echo "Tailscale not authenticated yet"
    echo "Run: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=osrs-wiki-dev"
fi
echo "========================================="
EOF

chmod +x ~/tailscale-info.sh

# Create stop script
cat > ~/stop-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Stop Tailscale daemon

if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Stopping Tailscale daemon..."
    pkill tailscaled
    echo "Tailscale daemon stopped"
else
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/stop-tailscale.sh

# Add Tailscale environment to shell profile
echo '' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc

# Also add to .claude-env if it exists
if [ -f /workspace/.claude-env ]; then
    echo '' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
fi

echo "✓ Tailscale userspace setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "Quick start commands:"
echo "  ~/start-tailscale.sh   - Start Tailscale daemon"  
echo "  ~/tailscale-info.sh    - Show connection info"
echo "  ts-start               - Alias for start script"
echo "  ts-status              - Alias for info script"
echo ""
echo "To enable remote access after container starts:"
echo "  1. Run: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
echo "  2. Authenticate via the provided URL"
echo "  3. Connect from mobile using SSH or MOSH"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# Setup Tailscale userspace configuration (no sudo required)
# Runs as vscode user during container creation

set -e

echo "Setting up Tailscale userspace configuration..."

# Create state directory (Docker volume, can't chmod)
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Create start script
cat > ~/start-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Start Tailscale in userspace mode (no sudo needed)

set -e

# Check if already running
if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon already running"
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock status
    exit 0
fi

echo "Starting Tailscale in userspace mode..."

# Create socket directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Debug: check permissions
echo "Directory permissions: $(ls -ld ~/.tailscale)"
echo "Can write test: $(touch ~/.tailscale/test.txt 2>&1 && echo "OK" || echo "FAILED")"
rm -f ~/.tailscale/test.txt

# Start daemon in background with userspace networking
echo "Starting tailscaled daemon..."
tailscaled \
    --tun=userspace-networking \
    --socks5-server=localhost:1055 \
    --state=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.state \
    --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock \
    > /home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.log 2>&1 &

# Wait for daemon to start
echo "Waiting for Tailscale daemon to start..."
for i in {1..10}; do
    if [ -S ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock ]; then
        echo "Tailscale daemon started successfully"
        break
    fi
    if [ $i -eq 10 ]; then
        echo "Error: Tailscale daemon failed to start"
        echo "Debug info:"
        ls -la ~/.tailscale/
        if [ -f ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log ]; then
            echo "Log contents:"
            tail -20 ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log
        else
            echo "No log file found"
        fi
        exit 1
    fi
    sleep 1
done

# Configure Tailscale with SSH
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
    echo "Configuring Tailscale with provided auth key..."
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock up \
        --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" \
        --ssh \
        --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
    echo "✅ Tailscale configured successfully!"
else
    echo "⚠️ No auth key provided - authentication will be required."
    echo "Run ./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh after container setup to authenticate."
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/start-tailscale.sh

# Create status/info script
cat > ~/tailscale-info.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Get Tailscale connection info (no sudo needed)

export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
    echo "Start with: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
    exit 1
fi

if ! [ -S "$TS_SOCKET" ]; then
    echo "Tailscale socket not found at $TS_SOCKET"
    exit 1
fi

echo "========================================="
echo "Tailscale Status"
echo "========================================="
tailscale status
echo ""
echo "Tailscale IP addresses:"
tailscale ip
echo ""

# Get the main IPv4 address
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "Mobile SSH Connection Commands:"
    echo "  Direct IP:  ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "  Hostname:   ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "For stable mobile connections (MOSH):"
    echo "  mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "Container Details:"
    echo "  Android Serial: ${ANDROID_SERIAL:-<not set>}"
    echo "  SSH via Tailscale: Available"
else
    echo "Tailscale not authenticated yet"
    echo "Run: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=osrs-wiki-dev"
fi
echo "========================================="
EOF

chmod +x ~/tailscale-info.sh

# Create stop script
cat > ~/stop-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Stop Tailscale daemon

if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Stopping Tailscale daemon..."
    pkill tailscaled
    echo "Tailscale daemon stopped"
else
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/stop-tailscale.sh

# Add Tailscale environment to shell profile
echo '' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc

# Also add to .claude-env if it exists
if [ -f /workspace/.claude-env ]; then
    echo '' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
fi

echo "✓ Tailscale userspace setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "Quick start commands:"
echo "  ~/start-tailscale.sh   - Start Tailscale daemon"  
echo "  ~/tailscale-info.sh    - Show connection info"
echo "  ts-start               - Alias for start script"
echo "  ts-status              - Alias for info script"
echo ""
echo "To enable remote access after container starts:"
echo "  1. Run: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
echo "  2. Authenticate via the provided URL"
echo "  3. Connect from mobile using SSH or MOSH"

#!/bin/bash
# Setup Tailscale userspace configuration (no sudo required)
# Runs as vscode user during container creation

set -e

echo "Setting up Tailscale userspace configuration..."

# Create state directory (Docker volume, can't chmod)
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Create start script
cat > ~/start-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Start Tailscale in userspace mode (no sudo needed)

set -e

# Check if already running
if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon already running"
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock status
    exit 0
fi

echo "Starting Tailscale in userspace mode..."

# Create socket directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Debug: check permissions
echo "Directory permissions: $(ls -ld ~/.tailscale)"
echo "Can write test: $(touch ~/.tailscale/test.txt 2>&1 && echo "OK" || echo "FAILED")"
rm -f ~/.tailscale/test.txt

# Start daemon in background with userspace networking
echo "Starting tailscaled daemon..."
tailscaled \
    --tun=userspace-networking \
    --socks5-server=localhost:1055 \
    --state=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.state \
    --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock \
    > /home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.log 2>&1 &

# Wait for daemon to start
echo "Waiting for Tailscale daemon to start..."
for i in {1..10}; do
    if [ -S ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock ]; then
        echo "Tailscale daemon started successfully"
        break
    fi
    if [ $i -eq 10 ]; then
        echo "Error: Tailscale daemon failed to start"
        echo "Debug info:"
        ls -la ~/.tailscale/
        if [ -f ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log ]; then
            echo "Log contents:"
            tail -20 ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log
        else
            echo "No log file found"
        fi
        exit 1
    fi
    sleep 1
done

# Configure Tailscale with SSH
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
    echo "Configuring Tailscale with provided auth key..."
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock up \
        --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" \
        --ssh \
        --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
    echo "✅ Tailscale configured successfully!"
else
    echo "⚠️ No auth key provided - authentication will be required."
    echo "Run ./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh after container setup to authenticate."
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/start-tailscale.sh

# Create status/info script
cat > ~/tailscale-info.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Get Tailscale connection info (no sudo needed)

export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
    echo "Start with: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
    exit 1
fi

if ! [ -S "$TS_SOCKET" ]; then
    echo "Tailscale socket not found at $TS_SOCKET"
    exit 1
fi

echo "========================================="
echo "Tailscale Status"
echo "========================================="
tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status
echo ""
echo "Tailscale IP addresses:"
tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" ip
echo ""

# Get the main IPv4 address
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "Mobile SSH Connection Commands:"
    echo "  Direct IP:  ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "  Hostname:   ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "For stable mobile connections (MOSH):"
    echo "  mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "Container Details:"
    echo "  Android Serial: ${ANDROID_SERIAL:-<not set>}"
    echo "  SSH via Tailscale: Available"
else
    echo "Tailscale not authenticated yet"
    echo "Run: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=osrs-wiki-dev"
fi
echo "========================================="
EOF

chmod +x ~/tailscale-info.sh

# Create stop script
cat > ~/stop-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Stop Tailscale daemon

if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Stopping Tailscale daemon..."
    pkill tailscaled
    echo "Tailscale daemon stopped"
else
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/stop-tailscale.sh

# Add Tailscale environment to shell profile
echo '' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias m="./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc

# Also add to .claude-env if it exists
if [ -f /workspace/.claude-env ]; then
    echo '' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
fi

echo "✓ Tailscale userspace setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "Quick start commands:"
echo "  ~/start-tailscale.sh   - Start Tailscale daemon"  
echo "  ~/tailscale-info.sh    - Show connection info"
echo "  ts-start               - Alias for start script"
echo "  ts-status              - Alias for info script"
echo ""
echo "To enable remote access after container starts:"
echo "  1. Run: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
echo "  2. Authenticate via the provided URL"
echo "  3. Connect from mobile using SSH or MOSH"

content.text:
Perfect! I've fixed the socket path issue and added the convenient "m" alias. Here's what I changed:

## 🔧 Fixed Socket Path Issues

**The Problem**: Tailscale commands were trying to use the default socket (`/var/run/tailscale/tailscaled.sock`) instead of our custom socket (`/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock`).

**The Solution**: Updated all `tailscale` commands to explicitly use `--socket="$TS_SOCKET"`.

### **Fixed Commands**
- ✅ `tailscale status` → `tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status`  
- ✅ `tailscale up` → `tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up`
- ✅ `tailscale ip` → `tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" ip`

## 🚀 Added Convenience Alias

**New "m" alias**: `alias m="./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh"`

### **Quick Usage**
```bash
# After container builds, just type:
m

# This runs the full mobile access setup with:
# - Auto browser opening
# - Interactive authentication  
# - Connection info display
```

## 🔄 Try the Fixed Version

Now try running `./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh` (or just `m` if you source the environment). You should see:

```
🔍 Running: tailscale --socket="/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock" up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
📝 Command exit code: 0
📄 Full output:
To authenticate, visit:
https://login.tailscale.com/a/xxxxxxxxx

🌐 Found authentication URL: https://login.tailscale.com/a/xxxxxxxxx
```

The socket path error should be resolved, and authentication should work properly! After the next container rebuild, you'll have the convenient `m` alias available.

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status &> /dev/null; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Starting interactive authentication..."
        echo "This will open the browser for you to approve the device."
        echo ""
        
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale --socket=\"$TS_SOCKET\" up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Run tailscale up and capture output with better error handling
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📝 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Full output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Extract URL from output - try multiple patterns
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        # Alternative pattern in case the format is different
        if [ -z "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com[^[:space:]]*' | head -1)
        fi
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🌐 Found authentication URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo "🖱️  Attempting to open in browser..."
            
            # Try multiple methods to open URL
            OPENED=false
            
            if command -v python3 >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo "  Trying python3 webbrowser..."
                if python3 -c "import webbrowser; webbrowser.open('$AUTH_URL')" 2>&1; then
                    OPENED=true
                    echo "  ✅ Opened with python3"
                fi
            fi
            
            if ! $OPENED && command -v xdg-open >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo "  Trying xdg-open..."
                if xdg-open "$AUTH_URL" 2>&1; then
                    OPENED=true
                    echo "  ✅ Opened with xdg-open"
                fi
            fi
            
            if ! $OPENED; then
                echo "  ⚠️  Could not auto-open browser. Please manually open:"
            fi
            
            echo ""
            echo "🔗 Authentication URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open the URL above in your browser, approve the device, then press ENTER to continue..."
            read -r
            
            echo "🔍 Verifying authentication..."
            
            # Verify authentication with retries
            for i in {1..5}; do
                if tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                    echo "✅ Authentication successful!"
                    break
                elif [ $i -eq 5 ]; then
                    echo "❌ Authentication verification failed after 5 attempts."
                    echo "Please check your Tailscale admin panel or try:"
                    echo "tailscale --socket=\"$TS_SOCKET\" up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
                    exit 1
                else
                    echo "⏳ Attempt $i/5: Waiting for authentication to complete..."
                    sleep 2
                fi
            done
        else
            echo "❌ Could not extract authentication URL from output."
            echo "This might indicate Tailscale is already authenticated or there was an error."
            echo ""
            echo "Let's check current status:"
            tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status || echo "Status check failed"
            echo ""
            echo "If you need to re-authenticate manually, run:"
            echo "tailscale --socket=\"$TS_SOCKET\" up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            
            # Don't exit here - continue to show connection info if possible
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

content.text:
Perfect! I've simplified the authentication process to be much cleaner and more reliable. Here's what the new flow looks like:

## 🚀 Simplified Authentication Flow

### **When you run `m` (or `./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh`):**

**First time (needs authentication):**
```
📱 Tailscale Authentication Required
=====================================
Manual authentication required:

🔍 Run this command to get your authentication URL:
tailscale --socket="/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock" up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"

Then:
1. Copy the authentication URL from the output
2. Open it in your browser  
3. Sign in and approve the device
4. Run 'm' again to see your connection info
```

**After authentication (subsequent runs):**
```
✅ Already authenticated!
[Shows connection info with IP addresses and SSH commands]
```

## 🎯 Simple Steps for You

1. **Run**: `m`  
2. **Copy & run** the tailscale command it shows you
3. **Copy the URL** from that command's output  
4. **Open URL** in browser and approve
5. **Run**: `m` again to see your connection info

This approach:
- ✅ **No hanging** on interactive commands
- ✅ **No browser opening issues** 
- ✅ **Clear step-by-step** instructions
- ✅ **Works reliably** across different environments
- ✅ **One-time setup** as you wanted

Much cleaner and more reliable! Try running `m` now and it should give you clear instructions without any hanging issues.

content.text: I see the issue! The error "flag provided multiple times" means that the `tailscale` alias is already adding the `--socket` flag, so when we add it again explicitly, it conflicts. Let me fix this:

Update script to use tailscale alias without explicit socket

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status &> /dev/null; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Manual authentication required:"
        echo ""
        echo "🔍 Run this command to get your authentication URL:"
        echo "tailscale --socket=\"$TS_SOCKET\" up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        echo ""
        echo "Then:"
        echo "1. Copy the authentication URL from the output"
        echo "2. Open it in your browser"
        echo "3. Sign in and approve the device"
        echo "4. Run 'm' again to see your connection info"
        echo ""
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

#!/bin/bash
# Setup Tailscale userspace configuration (no sudo required)
# Runs as vscode user during container creation

set -e

echo "Setting up Tailscale userspace configuration..."

# Create state directory (Docker volume, can't chmod)
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Create start script
cat > ~/start-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Start Tailscale in userspace mode (no sudo needed)

set -e

# Check if already running
if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon already running"
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock status
    exit 0
fi

echo "Starting Tailscale in userspace mode..."

# Create socket directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p ~/.tailscale

# Debug: check permissions
echo "Directory permissions: $(ls -ld ~/.tailscale)"
echo "Can write test: $(touch ~/.tailscale/test.txt 2>&1 && echo "OK" || echo "FAILED")"
rm -f ~/.tailscale/test.txt

# Start daemon in background with userspace networking
echo "Starting tailscaled daemon..."
tailscaled \
    --tun=userspace-networking \
    --socks5-server=localhost:1055 \
    --state=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.state \
    --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock \
    > /home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.log 2>&1 &

# Wait for daemon to start
echo "Waiting for Tailscale daemon to start..."
for i in {1..10}; do
    if [ -S ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock ]; then
        echo "Tailscale daemon started successfully"
        break
    fi
    if [ $i -eq 10 ]; then
        echo "Error: Tailscale daemon failed to start"
        echo "Debug info:"
        ls -la ~/.tailscale/
        if [ -f ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log ]; then
            echo "Log contents:"
            tail -20 ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.log
        else
            echo "No log file found"
        fi
        exit 1
    fi
    sleep 1
done

# Configure Tailscale with SSH
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
    echo "Configuring Tailscale with provided auth key..."
    tailscale --socket=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock up \
        --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" \
        --ssh \
        --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
    echo "✅ Tailscale configured successfully!"
else
    echo "⚠️ No auth key provided - authentication will be required."
    echo "Run ./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh after container setup to authenticate."
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/start-tailscale.sh

# Create status/info script
cat > ~/tailscale-info.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Get Tailscale connection info (no sudo needed)

export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
    echo "Start with: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
    exit 1
fi

if ! [ -S "$TS_SOCKET" ]; then
    echo "Tailscale socket not found at $TS_SOCKET"
    exit 1
fi

echo "========================================="
echo "Tailscale Status"
echo "========================================="
tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" status
echo ""
echo "Tailscale IP addresses:"
tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" ip
echo ""

# Get the main IPv4 address
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale --socket="$TS_SOCKET" ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "Mobile SSH Connection Commands:"
    echo "  Direct IP:  ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "  Hostname:   ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "For stable mobile connections (MOSH):"
    echo "  mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "Container Details:"
    echo "  Android Serial: ${ANDROID_SERIAL:-<not set>}"
    echo "  SSH via Tailscale: Available"
else
    echo "Tailscale not authenticated yet"
    echo "Run: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=osrs-wiki-dev"
fi
echo "========================================="
EOF

chmod +x ~/tailscale-info.sh

# Create stop script
cat > ~/stop-tailscale.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# Stop Tailscale daemon

if pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Stopping Tailscale daemon..."
    pkill tailscaled
    echo "Tailscale daemon stopped"
else
    echo "Tailscale daemon not running"
fi
EOF

chmod +x ~/stop-tailscale.sh

# Add Tailscale environment to shell profile
echo '' >> ~/.bashrc
echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'alias m="./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh"' >> ~/.bashrc

# Also add to .claude-env if it exists
if [ -f /workspace/.claude-env ]; then
    echo '' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo '# Tailscale configuration (sudo-free)' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-status="~/tailscale-info.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-start="~/start-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias ts-stop="~/stop-tailscale.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
    echo 'alias m="./scripts/setup-mobile-access.sh"' >> /workspace/.claude-env
fi

echo "✓ Tailscale userspace setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "Quick start commands:"
echo "  ~/start-tailscale.sh   - Start Tailscale daemon"  
echo "  ~/tailscale-info.sh    - Show connection info"
echo "  ts-start               - Alias for start script"
echo "  ts-status              - Alias for info script"
echo ""
echo "To enable remote access after container starts:"
echo "  1. Run: ~/start-tailscale.sh"
echo "  2. Authenticate via the provided URL"
echo "  3. Connect from mobile using SSH or MOSH"

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

if ! tailscale status &> /dev/null; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Manual authentication required:"
        echo ""
        echo "🔍 Run this command to get your authentication URL:"
        echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        echo ""
        echo "Then:"
        echo "1. Copy the authentication URL from the output"
        echo "2. Open it in your browser"
        echo "3. Sign in and approve the device"
        echo "4. Run 'm' again to see your connection info"
        echo ""
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

content.text:
Perfect! I've fixed both issues:

## 🔧 Fixed the Socket Flag Issue

**The Problem**: The `tailscale` alias already includes `--socket=$TS_SOCKET`, so adding `--socket` again caused "flag provided multiple times" error.

**The Solution**: Removed explicit `--socket` flags and just use the `tailscale` alias.

## 🚀 Automatic Command + Manual Click

Now when you run `m`, it will:

1. **Automatically run**: `tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"`
2. **Show the output** so you can see what happened
3. **Extract and highlight** the authentication URL
4. **Tell you to click** the URL manually in your browser
5. **Remind you** to run `m` again after approval

### **Example Flow**:
```
📱 Tailscale Authentication Required
=====================================
Running authentication command automatically...

🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
📄 Output:
To authenticate, visit:
https://login.tailscale.com/a/xxxxxxxxx

🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: https://login.tailscale.com/a/xxxxxxxxx

✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device.
Then run 'm' again to see your connection info.
```

This gives you the best of both worlds:
- ✅ **No manual command typing**  
- ✅ **No problematic auto-browser opening**
- ✅ **Clear URL to click**
- ✅ **Simple workflow**

Try running `m` now - it should work smoothly and show you the authentication URL clearly!

            exit 1

        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            # Check if already authenticated
            if echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -q "Success"; then
                echo "✅ Authentication appears to be successful!"
                echo "Running connection info..."
                # Continue to show connection info instead of exiting
            else
                echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
                echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
                exit 0
            fi
        fi

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

# Check tailscale status with better error handling
STATUS_OUTPUT=$(tailscale status 2>&1)
STATUS_EXIT_CODE=$?

echo "🔍 Checking Tailscale status..."
echo "Status output: $STATUS_OUTPUT"
echo "Exit code: $STATUS_EXIT_CODE"
echo ""

if [ $STATUS_EXIT_CODE -ne 0 ] || echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "not logged in"; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Running authentication command automatically..."
        echo ""
        
        # Run the command and capture output
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        
        echo "📄 Output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
            echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
        fi
        echo ""
        exit 0
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

if [ $STATUS_EXIT_CODE -ne 0 ] || echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "not logged in"; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Running authentication command automatically..."
        echo ""
        
        # Run the command with timeout and proper error handling
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Use timeout to prevent hanging and run in foreground
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(timeout 30s tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📄 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Check if command timed out
        if [ $AUTH_EXIT_CODE -eq 124 ]; then
            echo "⏰ Command timed out after 30 seconds."
            echo "This might mean authentication is needed. Please run manually:"
            echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            # Check if already authenticated
            if echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -q "Success"; then
                echo "✅ Authentication appears to be successful!"
                echo "Running connection info..."
                # Continue to show connection info instead of exiting
            else
                echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
                echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
                exit 0
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
else
    echo "✅ Tailscale is already authenticated!"
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"

    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then

        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

content.text:
Can you first try running this manually in your container to see what's happening:

```bash
# Let's debug the status check step by step
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock
echo "Socket: $TS_SOCKET"

# Check if socket exists
ls -la ~/.tailscale/

# Try status command with explicit socket
tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET status

# Try the alias version
source ~/.bashrc
tailscale status
```

This will help us understand why the script is hanging. I suspect the issue is that the Tailscale daemon from the previous session is still using the old authentication, but the new container can't access it properly.

Since you already have `osrs-wiki-dev` authenticated in your Tailscale admin panel, the issue is likely that:

1. The state files from the previous authentication aren't being read properly
2. The daemon is starting fresh each time instead of using the persistent authentication

Let me also check what's in the tailscale state directory:

```bash
ls -la ~/.tailscale/
cat ~/.tailscale/tailscaled.state 2>/dev/null || echo "No state file"
```

Once I understand what's happening with these debug commands, I can fix the script properly.

Perfect! Now I understand what's happening. The Tailscale daemon IS working and authenticated (we can see the status shows `osrs-wiki-dev` connected with IP `100.122.29.126`), but there's a duplicate `--socket` flag issue with the alias.

The problem is in our `.bashrc` alias: `alias tailscale="tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET"`. When we run `tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET status`, it becomes `tailscale --socket=$TS_SOCKET --socket=$TS_SOCKET status` (duplicate flag).

But after sourcing `.bashrc`, the plain `tailscale status` command works perfectly! Let me fix this:

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

# Source environment to get aliases
if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then
    source ~/.bashrc
fi

# Check tailscale status with better error handling
STATUS_OUTPUT=$(tailscale status 2>&1)
STATUS_EXIT_CODE=$?

echo "🔍 Checking Tailscale status..."
echo "Status output: $STATUS_OUTPUT"
echo "Exit code: $STATUS_EXIT_CODE"
echo ""

if [ $STATUS_EXIT_CODE -ne 0 ] || echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "not logged in"; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Running authentication command automatically..."
        echo ""
        
        # Run the command with timeout and proper error handling
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Use timeout to prevent hanging and run in foreground
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(timeout 30s tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📄 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Check if command timed out
        if [ $AUTH_EXIT_CODE -eq 124 ]; then
            echo "⏰ Command timed out after 30 seconds."
            echo "This might mean authentication is needed. Please run manually:"
            echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            # Check if already authenticated
            if echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -q "Success"; then
                echo "✅ Authentication appears to be successful!"
                echo "Running connection info..."
                # Continue to show connection info instead of exiting
            else
                echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
                echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
                exit 0
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
else
    echo "✅ Tailscale is already authenticated!"
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"

#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

# Source environment to get aliases
if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then
    source ~/.bashrc
fi

# Check tailscale status with better error handling
echo "🔍 Checking Tailscale status..."
STATUS_OUTPUT=$(tailscale status 2>&1)
STATUS_EXIT_CODE=$?

echo "Status output: $STATUS_OUTPUT"
echo "Exit code: $STATUS_EXIT_CODE"
echo ""

# Check if Tailscale is connected (exit code 0 and no "not logged in" message)
if [ $STATUS_EXIT_CODE -eq 0 ] && ! echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "not logged in" && echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "100\."; then
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Running authentication command automatically..."
        echo ""
        
        # Run the command with timeout and proper error handling
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Use timeout to prevent hanging and run in foreground
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(timeout 30s tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📄 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Check if command timed out
        if [ $AUTH_EXIT_CODE -eq 124 ]; then
            echo "⏰ Command timed out after 30 seconds."
            echo "This might mean authentication is needed. Please run manually:"
            echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            # Check if already authenticated
            if echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -q "Success"; then
                echo "✅ Authentication appears to be successful!"
                echo "Running connection info..."
                # Continue to show connection info instead of exiting
            else
                echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
                echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
                exit 0
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
else
    echo "✅ Tailscale is already authenticated!"
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
# Setup mobile access without sudo requirements
# This script prepares Tailscale for remote SSH access

set -e

# Load session environment if available
source .claude-env 2>/dev/null || true

echo "Setting up mobile access (sudo-free)..."
echo "======================================="

# Check if we're in a container
if [ "$IS_CONTAINER" = "true" ]; then
    echo "✓ Running in container environment"
else
    echo "⚠ Not in container - some features may not work"
fi

# Check if Tailscale is installed
if ! command -v tailscale &> /dev/null; then
    echo "❌ Error: Tailscale not installed"
    echo "Make sure you're running in the devcontainer with Tailscale installed"
    exit 1
fi

# Check required directories
if [ ! -d ~/.tailscale ]; then
    echo "Creating Tailscale state directory..."
    mkdir -p ~/.tailscale
fi

# Start Tailscale if not running
if ! pgrep tailscaled > /dev/null; then
    echo "Starting Tailscale daemon..."
    ~/start-tailscale.sh
    
    # Wait a bit for the daemon to fully start
    sleep 3
fi

# Check if we need authentication
export TS_SOCKET=/home/vscode/.tailscale/tailscaled.sock

# Source environment to get aliases
if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then
    source ~/.bashrc
fi

# Check tailscale status with better error handling
echo "🔍 Checking Tailscale status..."
STATUS_OUTPUT=$(tailscale status 2>&1)
STATUS_EXIT_CODE=$?

echo "Status output: $STATUS_OUTPUT"
echo "Exit code: $STATUS_EXIT_CODE"
echo ""

# Check if Tailscale is connected (exit code 0 and has Tailscale IP)
if [ $STATUS_EXIT_CODE -eq 0 ] && echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep -q "100\."; then
    echo "✅ Tailscale is already authenticated and connected!"
    echo "Your device: osrs-wiki-dev"
    TAILSCALE_IP=$(echo "$STATUS_OUTPUT" | grep "100\." | head -1 | awk '{print $1}')
    echo "Tailscale IP: $TAILSCALE_IP"
else
    echo ""
    echo "📱 Tailscale Authentication Required"
    echo "====================================="
    
    # Check if we have an auth key
    if [ -n "$TS_AUTHKEY" ] && [ "$TS_AUTHKEY" != "" ]; then
        echo "Using provided auth key for automatic setup..."
        tailscale up --authkey="$TS_AUTHKEY" --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev"
        echo "✅ Authentication complete!"
    else
        echo "Running authentication command automatically..."
        echo ""
        
        # Run the command with timeout and proper error handling
        echo "🔍 Running: tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
        
        # Use timeout to prevent hanging and run in foreground
        set +e  # Don't exit on error
        AUTH_OUTPUT=$(timeout 30s tailscale up --ssh --hostname="osrs-wiki-dev" 2>&1)
        AUTH_EXIT_CODE=$?
        set -e  # Re-enable exit on error
        
        echo "📄 Command exit code: $AUTH_EXIT_CODE"
        echo "📄 Output:"
        echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT"
        echo ""
        
        # Check if command timed out
        if [ $AUTH_EXIT_CODE -eq 124 ]; then
            echo "⏰ Command timed out after 30 seconds."
            echo "This might mean authentication is needed. Please run manually:"
            echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"
            echo ""
            echo "✋ Please open this URL in your browser, sign in and approve the device."
            echo "Then run 'm' again to see your connection info."
        else
            # Check if already authenticated
            if echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -q "Success"; then
                echo "✅ Authentication appears to be successful!"
                echo "Running connection info..."
                # Continue to show connection info instead of exiting
            else
                echo "⚠️  Could not find authentication URL in output."
                echo "Please check the output above for instructions."
                exit 0
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo "⏳ Waiting for Tailscale to fully connect..."
    sleep 3
fi

# Display connection information
echo ""
~/tailscale-info.sh

echo ""
echo "📱 Mobile Setup Instructions"
echo "============================"
echo "1. Install Tailscale app on your mobile device"
echo "2. Sign in with the same account"
echo "3. Your device will appear in your tailnet automatically"
echo ""

# Get connection details
TAILSCALE_IP=$(tailscale ip -4 2>/dev/null | head -n1)
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)

if [ -n "$TAILSCALE_IP" ]; then
    echo "4. Use any SSH client to connect:"
    echo "   • Termux (Android): ssh vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo "   • Blink (iOS): Host: $TAILSCALE_IP, User: vscode"
    echo "   • Or hostname: ssh vscode@$HOSTNAME"
    echo ""
    echo "5. For unstable connections, use MOSH:"
    echo "   mosh --port=60000 vscode@$TAILSCALE_IP"
    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available
    if [ -n "$ANDROID_SERIAL" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"

            echo "tailscale up --ssh --hostname=\"osrs-wiki-dev\""
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Extract URL from output
        AUTH_URL=$(echo "$AUTH_OUTPUT" | grep -o 'https://login\.tailscale\.com/a/[a-zA-Z0-9]*' | head -1)
        
        if [ -n "$AUTH_URL" ]; then
            echo "🔗 AUTHENTICATION URL: $AUTH_URL"

    echo ""
    echo "🔧 Once Connected"
    echo "================"
    echo "• Start mobile session: ./scripts/mobile-session.sh"
    echo "• Run Claude Code: claude"
    echo "• Access Android emulator: adb devices"
    echo "• Session environment: source .claude-env"
    
    # Show Android setup if available

        echo "📱 Android Development Ready"
        echo "==========================="
        echo "• Device: $ANDROID_SERIAL"
        echo "• Test with: adb -s \"$ANDROID_SERIAL\" shell echo 'Connected!'"
    fi
else
    echo "⚠ No Tailscale IP found - authentication may be incomplete"
fi

echo ""
echo "✅ Mobile access setup complete!"
echo ""
echo "💡 Tips:"
echo "• Keep this terminal open for connection info"
echo "• Use 'ts-status' command to check connection anytime"
echo "• Sessions persist across network changes with MOSH"
echo "• Multiple mobile devices can connect simultaneously"
